SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.Controller

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
it.polimi.ingsw.Controller.Controller
All Implemented Interfaces:
ControllerRemoteInterface, Serializable, Remote
public class Controller extends UnicastRemoteObject implements ControllerRemoteInterface
The Controller class handles the game logic and communication between the server and clients.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Controller

      public Controller() throws IOException
      Creates an instance of the Controller class. Initializes the lists and variables used to manage games and players. Loads the saved games from the file system, if any.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs when reading from the file system.

  • Method Details

    • saveControllerStatus

      public void saveControllerStatus()
      Saves the current state of the controller to a file. The saved file includes the current game ID, already used player IDs, and player credentials.

    • choosePlayerId

      public void choosePlayerId(String playerId) throws PlayerIdAlreadyInUseException, PlayerOnlineException
      Allows a player to choose their ID.
      Specified by:
      choosePlayerId in interface ControllerRemoteInterface
      Parameters:
      playerId - the ID chosen by the player.
      Throws:
      PlayerIdAlreadyInUseException - if the chosen player ID is already in use.
      PlayerOnlineException - if the player with the chosen ID is already online.

    • addPlayerToCreatedGame

      public int addPlayerToCreatedGame(Observer observer, String playerId) throws CreateNewGameException, AlreadyStartedGameException
      Adds a player to a game that has already been created.
      Specified by:
      addPlayerToCreatedGame in interface ControllerRemoteInterface
      Parameters:
      observer - the observer associated with the player.
      playerId - the ID of the player.
      Returns:
      the ID of the game to which the player was added.
      Throws:
      CreateNewGameException - if there is no game currently available to join.
      AlreadyStartedGameException - if the game has already started.

    • disconnectClient

      public static void disconnectClient(String playerId)
      Disconnects a client with the specified player ID.
      Parameters:
      playerId - the ID of the player to be disconnected.

    • createNewGameAndAddPlayer

      public int createNewGameAndAddPlayer(String playerId, int maxPlayers) throws MaxNumberOfPlayersException, IOException, AlreadyStartedGameException, GameAlreadyCreatedException
      Creates a new game and adds a player to it.
      Specified by:
      createNewGameAndAddPlayer in interface ControllerRemoteInterface
      Parameters:
      playerId - the ID of the player.
      maxPlayers - the maximum number of players for the game.
      Returns:
      the ID of the newly created game.
      Throws:
      MaxNumberOfPlayersException - if the maximum number of players is exceeded.
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs when reading from the file system.
      AlreadyStartedGameException - if a game has already been created.
      GameAlreadyCreatedException - if the game has already started.

    • update

      public static void update(int gameID) throws RemoteException, MissingPlayerException
      Updates the observers associated with the players in the specified game.
      Parameters:
      gameID - the ID of the game to be updated.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a remote error occurs during the update.
      MissingPlayerException - if a player is missing from the game.

      Retrieves the game status to be sent to the player.
      Parameters:
      game - the game object.
      playerId - the ID of the player.
      Returns:
      the GameStatusToSend object containing the game status.
      Throws:
      MissingPlayerException - if a player is missing from the game.

    • pickAndInsertInBookshelf

      public void pickAndInsertInBookshelf(ArrayList<Coordinates> tilesSelection, int column, int[] order, String playerId) throws RemoteException, PlayerIsWaitingException, SelectionIsEmptyException, SelectionNotValidException, ColumnNotValidException, PickedColumnOutOfBoundsException, PickDoesntFitColumnException, TilesSelectionSizeDifferentFromOrderLengthException, VoidBoardTileException, WrongConfigurationException
      Picks and inserts tiles into the bookshelf of the current player in the specified game.
      Specified by:
      pickAndInsertInBookshelf in interface ControllerRemoteInterface
      Parameters:
      tilesSelection - the list of selected coordinates.
      column - the index of the column where the tiles will be inserted.
      order - the order in which the tiles will be inserted.
      playerId - the ID of the player.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a remote error occurs during the operation.
      PlayerIsWaitingException - if the player is waiting for their turn.
      SelectionIsEmptyException - if the selection is empty.
      SelectionNotValidException - if the selection is not valid.
      ColumnNotValidException - if the column index is not valid.
      PickedColumnOutOfBoundsException - if the picked column is out of bounds.
      PickDoesntFitColumnException - if the picked tiles do not fit in the column.
      TilesSelectionSizeDifferentFromOrderLengthException - if the size of the tiles selection is different from the length of the order array.
      VoidBoardTileException - if the board tile is void.
      WrongConfigurationException - if the configuration is wrong.

    • fillCompletely

      public void fillCompletely() throws PickedColumnOutOfBoundsException, PickDoesntFitColumnException
      Fills current player's bookshelf.
      Specified by:
      fillCompletely in interface ControllerRemoteInterface
      Throws:
      PickedColumnOutOfBoundsException - if the picked column is out of bounds.
      PickDoesntFitColumnException - if the picked tiles do not fit in the column.

    • checkPassword

      public void checkPassword(String playerId, String password, Observer observer) throws WrongPasswordException, RemoteException
      Checks the password entered by the player and reconnects the player if the password is correct.
      Specified by:
      checkPassword in interface ControllerRemoteInterface
      Parameters:
      playerId - the ID of the player.
      password - the password entered by the player.
      observer - the observer associated with the player.
      Throws:
      WrongPasswordException - if the password is incorrect.
      RemoteException - if a remote error occurs during the operation.
